article_title: Forward Progress On Repeal Of Obamacare

article_metadata.description: The law being implemented today is in many ways quite different than the law passed by a very temporary super-majority of Democrats back in 2010. It is highly likely that the ACA-as-implemented could not possibly have secured enough votes for passage in March 2010 . Likewise, we already know that neither the ACA-as-enacted nor ACA-as-implemented could possibly secure majority support in today's Congress. Two conclusions emerge from this analysis. First, the fact that the president and Congress have been able to agree on the repeal of 5 provisions of the law, the defunding of 7 components and 12 other assorted delays or changes puts a lie to the repeated claim that obdurate Republicans have necessitated the executive overreach observed in the remaining 38 changes to the law as enacted. Obamacare has done more to eviscerate the rule of law and constitutional design than any other major piece of legislation in the modern era.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
